an4.104:1.3.eng: One is shallow but appears deep,

an4.104:1.4.eng: one is deep but appears shallow,

an4.104:1.5.eng: one is shallow and appears shallow, and

an4.104:1.6.eng: one is deep and appears deep.

an4.104:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro udakarahadūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.104:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to lakes are found in the world.

an4.104:1.10.eng: One is shallow but appears deep,

an4.104:1.11.eng: one is deep but appears shallow,

an4.104:1.12.eng: one is shallow and appears shallow, and

an4.104:1.13.eng: one is deep and appears deep.

an4.104:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti gambhīrobhāso?
an4.104:2.1.eng: And how is an individual shallow but appears deep?

an4.104:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.104:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.

an4.104:2.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.104:2.3.eng: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an4.104:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti gambhīrobhāso.
an4.104:2.4.eng: That’s how an individual is shallow but appears deep.

an4.104:2.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado uttāno gambhīrobhāso;
an4.104:2.5.eng: That individual is like a lake that’s shallow but appears deep, I say.

an4.104:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti uttānobhāso?
an4.104:3.1.eng: And how is an individual deep but appears shallow?

an4.104:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.104:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not impressive …

an4.104:3.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.104:3.3.eng: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.104:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti uttānobhāso.

an4.104:3.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado gambhīro uttānobhāso;

an4.104:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti uttānobhāso?
an4.104:4.1.eng: And how is an individual shallow and appears shallow?

an4.104:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.104:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not impressive …

an4.104:4.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.104:4.3.eng: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.104:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti uttānobhāso.

an4.104:4.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado uttāno uttānobhāso;

an4.104:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti gambhīrobhāso?
an4.104:5.1.eng: And how is an individual deep and appears deep?

an4.104:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.104:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is impressive …

an4.104:5.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.104:5.3.eng: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.104:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti gambhīrobhāso.

an4.104:5.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado gambhīro gambhīrobhāso;

an4.104:5.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro udakarahadūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.104:5.7.eng: These four individuals similar to lakes are found in the world.”

an4.105:1.3.eng: One is unripe but seems ripe,

an4.105:1.4.eng: one is ripe but seems unripe,

an4.105:1.5.eng: one is unripe and seems unripe, and

an4.105:1.6.eng: one is ripe and seems ripe.

an4.105:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro ambūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.105:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to mangoes are found in the world.

an4.105:1.10.eng: One is unripe but seems ripe,

an4.105:1.11.eng: one is ripe but seems unripe,

an4.105:1.12.eng: one is unripe and seems unripe, and

an4.105:1.13.eng: one is ripe and seems ripe.

an4.105:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti pakkavaṇṇī?
an4.105:2.1.eng: And how is an individual unripe but seems ripe?

an4.105:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.105:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.

an4.105:2.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.105:2.3.eng: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an4.105:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti pakkavaṇṇī.
an4.105:2.4.eng: That’s how an individual is unripe but seems ripe.

an4.105:2.5.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ āmaṃ pakkavaṇṇi;
an4.105:2.5.eng: That individual is like a mango that’s unripe but seems ripe, I say.

an4.105:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti āmavaṇṇī?
an4.105:3.1.eng: And how is an individual ripe but seems unripe?

an4.105:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.105:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not impressive …

an4.105:3.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.105:3.3.eng: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.105:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti āmavaṇṇī.

an4.105:3.5.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ pakkaṃ āmavaṇṇi;

an4.105:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti āmavaṇṇī?
an4.105:4.1.eng: And how is an individual unripe and seems unripe?

an4.105:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.105:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not impressive …

an4.105:4.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.105:4.3.eng: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.105:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti āmavaṇṇī.

an4.105:4.5.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ āmaṃ āmavaṇṇi;

an4.105:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti pakkavaṇṇī?
an4.105:5.1.eng: And how is an individual ripe and seems ripe?

an4.105:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
an4.105:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is impressive …

an4.105:5.3.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.105:5.3.eng: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.105:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti pakkavaṇṇī.

an4.105:5.5.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ pakkaṃ pakkavaṇṇi;

an4.105:5.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro ambūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.105:5.7.eng: These four individuals similar to mangoes are found in the world.”

an4.106:1.1.eng: (This is a ghost sutta: there is no text for it in any available editions.)

an4.107:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mice.

an4.107:1.3.eng: One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,

an4.107:1.4.eng: one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,

an4.107:1.5.eng: one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and

an4.107:1.6.eng: one both makes a hole and lives in it.

an4.107:1.7.eng: These are the four kinds of mice.

an4.107:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mūsikūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.107:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to mice are found in the world.

an4.107:1.10.eng: One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,

an4.107:1.11.eng: one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,

an4.107:1.12.eng: one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and

an4.107:1.13.eng: one both makes a hole and lives in it.

an4.107:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā hoti no vasitā?
an4.107:2.1.eng: And how does an individual make a hole but not live in it?

an4.107:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
an4.107:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual memorizes the teaching—

an4.107:2.3.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
an4.107:2.3.eng: statements, mixed prose & verse, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and elaborations.

an4.107:2.4.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.107:2.4.eng: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an4.107:2.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā.
an4.107:2.5.eng: That’s how an individual makes a hole but doesn’t live in it.

an4.107:2.6.pli: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā gādhaṃ kattā, no vasitā;
an4.107:2.6.eng: That individual is like a mouse that makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, I say.

an4.107:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā?
an4.107:3.1.eng: And how does an individual live in a hole but not make it?

an4.107:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇāti—
an4.107:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t memorize the teaching …

an4.107:3.3.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

an4.107:3.4.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.107:3.4.eng: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.107:3.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā.

an4.107:3.6.pli: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā;

an4.107:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti no vasitā?
an4.107:4.1.eng: And how does an individual neither make a hole nor live in it?

an4.107:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇāti—
an4.107:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t memorize the teaching …

an4.107:4.3.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

an4.107:4.4.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
an4.107:4.4.eng: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.107:4.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā.

an4.107:4.6.pli: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā;

an4.107:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca?
an4.107:5.1.eng: And how does an individual both make a hole and live in it?

an4.107:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
an4.107:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual memorizes the teaching …

an4.107:5.3.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

an4.107:5.4.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an4.107:5.4.eng: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

an4.107:5.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca.

an4.107:5.6.pli: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca;

an4.107:5.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mūsikūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.107:5.8.eng: These four individuals similar to mice are found in the world.”

an4.108:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of oxen.

an4.108:1.3.eng: One hostile to its own herd, not others;

an4.108:1.4.eng: one hostile to other herds, not its own;

an4.108:1.5.eng: one hostile to both its own herd and others; and

an4.108:1.6.eng: one hostile to neither its own herd nor others.

an4.108:1.7.eng: These are the four kinds of oxen.

an4.108:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro balībaddūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.108:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to oxen are found in the world.

an4.108:1.10.eng: One hostile to their own herd, not others;

an4.108:1.11.eng: one hostile to other herds, not their own;

an4.108:1.12.eng: one hostile to both their own herd and others; and

an4.108:1.13.eng: one hostile to neither their own herd nor others.

an4.108:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo?
an4.108:2.1.eng: And how is an individual hostile to their own herd, not others?

an4.108:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no paraparisaṃ.
an4.108:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual intimidates their own followers, not the followers of others.

an4.108:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo.
an4.108:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is hostile to their own herd, not others.

an4.108:2.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo sagavacaṇḍo, no paragavacaṇḍo;
an4.108:2.4.eng: That individual is like an ox that’s hostile to its own herd, not others.

an4.108:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo paragavacaṇḍo hoti, no sagavacaṇḍo?
an4.108:3.1.eng: And how is an individual hostile to other herds, not their own?

an4.108:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo paraparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no sakaparisaṃ.
an4.108:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual intimidates the followers of others, not their own. …

an4.108:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo paragavacaṇḍo hoti, no sagavacaṇḍo.

an4.108:3.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo paragavacaṇḍo, no sagavacaṇḍo;

an4.108:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo ca hoti paragavacaṇḍo ca?
an4.108:4.1.eng: And how is an individual hostile to both their own herd and others?

an4.108:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti paraparisañca.
an4.108:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual intimidates their own followers and the followers of others. …

an4.108:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo ca hoti paragavacaṇḍo ca.

an4.108:4.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo sagavacaṇḍo ca paragavacaṇḍo ca;

an4.108:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo neva sagavacaṇḍo hoti no paragavacaṇḍo?
an4.108:5.1.eng: And how is an individual hostile to neither their own herd nor others?

an4.108:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo neva sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no paraparisañca.
an4.108:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t intimidate their own followers or the followers of others.

an4.108:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo neva sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo.

an4.108:5.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo neva sagavacaṇḍo, no paragavacaṇḍo;

an4.108:5.6.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro balībaddūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.108:5.6.eng: These four individuals similar to oxen are found in the world.”

an4.109:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of tree.

an4.109:1.3.eng: One is a softwood surrounded by softwoods,

an4.109:1.4.eng: one is a softwood surrounded by hardwoods,

an4.109:1.5.eng: one is a hardwood surrounded by softwoods, and

an4.109:1.6.eng: one is a hardwood surrounded by hardwoods.

an4.109:1.7.eng: These are the four kinds of tree.

an4.109:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro rukkhūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.109:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to trees are found in the world.

an4.109:1.10.eng: One is a softwood surrounded by softwoods,

an4.109:1.11.eng: one is a softwood surrounded by hardwoods,

an4.109:1.12.eng: one is a hardwood surrounded by softwoods, and

an4.109:1.13.eng: one is a hardwood surrounded by hardwoods.

an4.109:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pheggu hoti phegguparivāro?
an4.109:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a softwood surrounded by softwoods?

an4.109:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo;
an4.109:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is unethical, of bad character,

an4.109:2.3.eng: and their followers are the same.

an4.109:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pheggu hoti phegguparivāro.
an4.109:2.4.eng: That’s how an individual is a softwood surrounded by softwoods.

an4.109:2.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, rukkho pheggu phegguparivāro;
an4.109:2.5.eng: That individual is like a softwood tree that’s surrounded by softwoods, I say.

an4.109:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pheggu hoti sāraparivāro?
an4.109:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a softwood surrounded by hardwoods?

an4.109:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo;
an4.109:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is unethical, of bad character,

an4.109:3.3.pli: parisā ca khvassa hoti sīlavatī kalyāṇadhammā.
an4.109:3.3.eng: but their followers are ethical, of good character. …

an4.109:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pheggu hoti sāraparivāro.

an4.109:3.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, rukkho pheggu sāraparivāro;

an4.109:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sāro hoti phegguparivāro?
an4.109:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a hardwood surrounded by softwoods?

an4.109:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo;
an4.109:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is ethical, of good character,

an4.109:4.3.pli: parisā ca khvassa hoti dussīlā pāpadhammā.
an4.109:4.3.eng: but their followers are unethical, of bad character. …

an4.109:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sāro hoti phegguparivāro.

an4.109:4.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, rukkho sāro phegguparivāro;

an4.109:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sāro hoti sāraparivāro?
an4.109:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a hardwood surrounded by hardwoods?

an4.109:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo;
an4.109:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is ethical, of good character,

an4.109:5.3.eng: and their followers are the same.

an4.109:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sāro hoti sāraparivāro.

an4.109:5.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, rukkho sāro sāraparivāro;

an4.109:5.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro rukkhūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.109:5.7.eng: These four individuals similar to trees are found in the world.”

an4.11:1.1.pli: “Carato cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while walking.

an4.11:1.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti,
an4.11:1.2.eng: They tolerate it and don’t give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

an4.11:1.3.pli: carampi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
an4.11:1.3.eng: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘not keen or prudent, always lazy, and lacking energy’ when walking.

an4.11:2.1.pli: Ṭhitassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:2.1.eng: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while standing …

an4.11:2.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti,

an4.11:2.3.pli: ṭhitopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.

an4.11:3.1.pli: Nisinnassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.

an4.11:3.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti,

an4.11:3.3.pli: nisinnopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.

an4.11:4.1.pli: Sayānassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno jāgarassa uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:4.1.eng: or when lying down while awake.

an4.11:4.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti,
an4.11:4.2.eng: They tolerate it and don’t give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

an4.11:4.3.pli: sayānopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jāgaro evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
an4.11:4.3.eng: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘not keen or prudent, always lazy, and lacking energy’ when lying down while awake.

an4.11:5.1.pli: Carato cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:5.1.eng: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while walking.

an4.11:5.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
an4.11:5.2.eng: They don’t tolerate it, but give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

an4.11:5.3.pli: carampi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.
an4.11:5.3.eng: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and resolute’ when walking.

an4.11:6.1.pli: Ṭhitassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:6.1.eng: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while standing …

an4.11:6.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;

an4.11:6.3.pli: ṭhitopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.

an4.11:7.1.pli: Nisinnassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.

an4.11:7.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;

an4.11:7.3.pli: nisinnopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.

an4.11:8.1.pli: Sayānassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno jāgarassa uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
an4.11:8.1.eng: or when lying down while awake.

an4.11:8.2.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
an4.11:8.2.eng: They don’t tolerate it, but give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

an4.11:8.3.pli: sayānopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jāgaro evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccatīti.
an4.11:8.3.eng: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and resolute’ when lying down while awake.”

an4.11:9.3.eng: if you think a bad thought

an4.11:9.4.eng: to do with the domestic life,

an4.11:11.1.pli: Yo ca caraṃ vā tiṭṭhaṃ vā,
an4.11:11.1.eng: But one who, whether standing or walking,

an4.110:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of viper.

an4.110:1.3.eng: One whose venom is fast-acting but not lethal,

an4.110:1.4.eng: one whose venom is lethal but not fast-acting,

an4.110:1.5.eng: one whose venom is both fast-acting and lethal, and

an4.110:1.6.eng: one whose venom is neither fast-acting nor lethal.

an4.110:1.7.eng: These are the four kinds of viper.

an4.110:1.8.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro āsīvisūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an4.110:1.8.eng: In the same way, these four individuals similar to vipers are found in the world.

an4.110:1.10.eng: One whose venom is fast-acting but not lethal,

an4.110:1.11.eng: one whose venom is lethal but not fast-acting,

an4.110:1.12.eng: one whose venom is both fast-acting and lethal, and

an4.110:1.13.eng: one whose venom is neither fast-acting nor lethal.

an4.110:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āgataviso hoti, na ghoraviso?
an4.110:2.1.eng: And how is an individual’s venom fast-acting but not lethal?

an4.110:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati.
an4.110:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is often angry,

an4.110:2.3.pli: So ca khvassa kodho na dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
an4.110:2.3.eng: but their anger doesn’t linger long.

an4.110:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āgataviso hoti, na ghoraviso.
an4.110:2.4.eng: That’s how an individual’s venom is fast-acting but not lethal.

an4.110:2.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, āsīviso āgataviso, na ghoraviso;
an4.110:2.5.eng: That individual is like a viper whose venom is fast-acting but not lethal.

an4.110:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo ghoraviso hoti, na āgataviso?
an4.110:3.1.eng: And how is an individual’s venom lethal but not fast-acting?

an4.110:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na heva kho abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati.
an4.110:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not often angry,

an4.110:3.3.pli: So ca khvassa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
an4.110:3.3.eng: but their anger lingers for a long time.

an4.110:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ghoraviso hoti, na āgataviso.

an4.110:3.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, āsīviso ghoraviso, na āgataviso;

an4.110:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āgataviso ca hoti ghoraviso ca?
an4.110:4.1.eng: And how is an individual’s venom both fast-acting and lethal?

an4.110:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati.
an4.110:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is often angry,

an4.110:4.3.pli: So ca khvassa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
an4.110:4.3.eng: and their anger lingers for a long time.

an4.110:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āgataviso ca hoti ghoraviso ca.

an4.110:4.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, āsīviso āgataviso ca ghoraviso ca;

an4.110:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevāgataviso hoti na ghoraviso?
an4.110:5.1.eng: And how is an individual’s venom neither fast-acting nor lethal?

an4.110:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na heva kho abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati.
an4.110:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not often angry,

an4.110:5.3.pli: So ca khvassa kodho na dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
an4.110:5.3.eng: and their anger doesn’t linger long.

an4.110:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevāgataviso hoti, na ghoraviso.

an4.110:5.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, āsīviso nevāgataviso na ghoraviso;

an4.110:5.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro āsīvisūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.110:5.7.eng: These four individuals similar to vipers are found in the world.”
